intro: Aegiphila pulcherrima, commonly known as the Brazilian mint or sweet pepper plant, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It is often grown for its ornamental value and its use in traditional medicine. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
